p: Japanese encephalitis virus, and some representatives of the Flavivirus genus (family Flaviviridae) are transmitted by mosquitoes and classically classified as neurotropic viruses, including West Nile virus (WNV) and Saint Louis encephalitis virus (SLEV) [4]. However, in recent years, other members of this genus, primarily Dengue virus (DENV) and Zika virus (ZIKV), have been associated with CNS infections [4], [5], [6].
